xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 02 May 2013
xwikidoc.content: <froggy> has joined #ccm 06:28 <BogdanVancea> has joined #ccm 09:13 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 09:57 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 11:19 <qwebirc28054> has joined #ccm 11:44 <krinye> has joined #ccm 11:44 <krinye> Hello guys any mentors around? 12:07 <sdumitriu1> Hi krinye 12:07 <sdumitriu1> Let me get Marc 12:13 <mfiume> has joined #ccm 12:21 <mfiume1> has joined #ccm 12:22 <mfiume> has joined #ccm 13:10 <roque> has joined #ccm 13:52 <khodeir> has joined #ccm 14:20 <phenotips_org> has joined #ccm 14:31 <BogdanVancea> has joined #ccm 15:43 <vshivam> has joined #ccm 15:47 <sdumitriu1> Hey vshivam, mfiume's here 15:47 <vshivam> Yeah hi :) 15:47 <vshivam> I did receive an email from him. 15:47 <sdumitriu1> OK 15:49 <vshivam> mfiume: I suppose, I wont be able to fill in details about the Project Timeline / Architecture since we haven't yet zeroed down on the idea. 15:50 <vshivam> I'll provide in detail, my skill sets and previous projects. 15:52 <vshivam> *zeroed down on the disease 15:55 <mfiume> Hi cshivam, those are the most important details at this time, yes 15:55 <mfiume> vshivam* 15:57 <vshivam> Thanks. 15:57 <mfiume> the architecture will involve 1) creating a reliable communications link between the mobile device and the biometric sensing unit, 2) receiving, formatting, and storing the relevant data 3) presenting the data to the user in a way that is aesthetically pleasing, interpretable, and relevant 4) creating analytics components on the server-side to compute trends in the data and (potentially) 5) developing a web-based dashboard for users and clinicians to acce 15:58 <mfiume> you may wish to expand / elaborate on these if you have your own ideas 15:58 <vshivam> hm. 15:58 <vshivam> Yeah, I have a few, 15:58 <mfiume> feel free to compare to bantapp.com to make ideas more concrete 15:59 <vshivam> I'll add on to these. 15:59 <vshivam> sure. 15:59 <mfiume> safeheart.ca is also something analogous that we're veloping 15:59 <mfiume> developing* 16:00 <vshivam> Yeah. I was thinking of putting this as an idea. 16:01 <vshivam> I mean, monitoring for Health Diseases 16:01 <vshivam> for Heart Patients 16:02 <vshivam> We could also sync the mobile device with a blood pressure monitor 16:02 <vshivam> if feasible 16:03 <vshivam> and it could give useful insights for cardiovascular diseases. 16:04 <krinye> has joined #ccm 16:05 <mfiume> take a look at http://www.scanadu.com 16:05 <mfiume> 'at home' biometric devices seem to be gaining popularity 16:07 <vshivam> Yeah. I read a few research papers about the same. 16:11 <vshivam> Scanadu is awesome 16:12 <vshivam> It'd be pretty great to work on something on similar lines 16:18 <mfiume> has left #ccm 16:28 <BogdanVancea> Hello everyone! 16:29 <sdumitriu1> Hi Bogdan 16:29 <sdumitriu1> Do you need Marc? 16:30 <BogdanVancea> sdumitriu1, do you have a few minutes to possibly discuss my proposed architecture and timeline for the Solr backend project? 16:30 <sdumitriu1> Yes 16:30 <BogdanVancea> yay 16:31 <BogdanVancea> I was thinking I'd first create a set of repository interfaces to encapsulate all the data access logic 16:32 <sdumitriu1> Yes 16:32 <BogdanVancea> Then proceed to create a first set of implementations for these repository interfaces and migrate all the current data access logic from within the managers there. 16:32 <sdumitriu1> Currently there are SQL queries scattered throughout the code 16:32 <sdumitriu1> Those should be replaced by API calls 16:32 <sdumitriu1> Exactly 16:33 <BogdanVancea> yep, I have browsed the code these last few days 16:33 <BogdanVancea> after finishing up cleaning the current code 16:33 <BogdanVancea> I would create implementations for the Solr backend 16:33 <BogdanVancea> which would actually be classes implementing the same repository interface 16:33 <mfiume> has joined #ccm 16:34 <BogdanVancea> so the Manager classes will not be aware they are using Solr or ICE objects, they just call the interfaces 16:34 <sdumitriu1> Yep 16:35 <BogdanVancea> Then proceed to write to some performance tests 16:35 <BogdanVancea> tbh, I've only tested Solr systems using SolrMeter 16:36 <BogdanVancea> to observe performance evolution with regard to scaling 16:36 <BogdanVancea> so I'm not exactly sure how the tests should look 16:36 <BogdanVancea> but I'm thinking the actual query time is important 16:36 <BogdanVancea> for the performance 16:36 <sdumitriu1> Yes 16:37 <BogdanVancea> Perhaps a comparison between the query times and the size of the data, you did mention that was the first reason ICE was chosen. 16:37 <sdumitriu1> Yes 16:38 <BogdanVancea> Cool :) 16:38 <sdumitriu1> The size will also depend on how much we want to store 16:39 <sdumitriu1> Solr can index without storing, which might give us an even better size than ICE 16:39 <sdumitriu1> But then we might want to be able to retrieve everything back, which means that we'll have both the index and the actual data 16:40 <BogdanVancea> I see. 16:41 <BogdanVancea> Do you know, approximatly, some numbers regarding the data currently stored by MedSavant? 16:42 <BogdanVancea> I havent been able to populate my local db instance with data. 16:42 <sdumitriu1> I think several gigabytes, with hundreds of millions of records 16:42 <sdumitriu1> mfiume: Is that correct? 16:42 <sdumitriu1> mfiume: We need some sample data for students 16:43 <BogdanVancea> There an exeption deliberatly set in the code stopping me to download the data. 16:43 <BogdanVancea> and I didn't remove it because of a comment there about someone being charged money ;)) 16:43 <BogdanVancea> But hunders of millions of records sounds awesome 16:43 <BogdanVancea> I haven;t worked with some many records 16:43 <BogdanVancea> :D 16:43 <BogdanVancea> yet 16:44 <mfiume> That stoppage doesnt relate to the main dataset 16:45 <mfiume> Sample datasets are in .vcf format 16:45 <mfiume> and can be downloaded from here, for example: ftp://ftp.1000genomes.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/ftp/phase1/analysis_results/paper/ 16:45 <BogdanVancea> Thank you :) 16:46 <mfiume> ftp://ftp-trace.ncbi.nih.gov/1000genomes/ftp/release 16:46 <mfiume> As you can see, they can be very large: ftp://ftp-trace.ncbi.nih.gov//1000genomes/ftp/release/20110521/ALL.chr1.phase1_release_v3.20101123.snps_indels_svs.genotypes.vcf.gz 16:47 <mfiume> A description of the format is here: http://www.1000genomes.org/wiki/Analysis/Variant%20Call%20Format/vcf-variant-call-format-version-41 16:47 <BogdanVancea> Hm..., it seems I cannot access the links 16:48 <BogdanVancea> Might be my dorm internet has some closed ports. 16:50 <mfiume> Perhaps 16:50 <mfiume> theyre working for me :( 16:50 <mfiume> has left #ccm 16:51 <BogdanVancea> I just check on my phone, the links are working on mobile data traffic. 16:51 <BogdanVancea> so its my internet 16:51 <BogdanVancea> :) 16:54 <BogdanVancea> 10.7 GB 16:54 <BogdanVancea> wow 16:54 <BogdanVancea> cool 16:54 <BogdanVancea> :D 16:56 <BogdanVancea> Anyway, I was thinking to dedicate about 4-6 weeks to testing alone 16:56 <BogdanVancea> so I can try more versions for the solr schema 16:57 <sdumitriu1> Yep 16:58 <sdumitriu1> Different types of indexers and query parsers 16:58 <BogdanVancea> yep 16:58 <BogdanVancea> there's a lot of tinkering that can be done there 16:59 <BogdanVancea> I would also like to try testing the performance on a solr cluster 17:00 <sdumitriu1> Yes, sharding is important 17:00 <sdumitriu1> Actually the most important 17:00 <BogdanVancea> I see :) 17:00 <BogdanVancea> Is the current ICE backend sharded? 17:01 <BogdanVancea> I mean, have you tried that on your servers? 17:01 <sdumitriu1> No, that's another proposed GSoC project 17:01 <BogdanVancea> I see 17:01 <BogdanVancea> :) 17:04 <BogdanVancea> Thank you Marc and Sergiu, for your time and feedback :) 17:04 <sdumitriu1> You're welcome 17:04 <BogdanVancea> The Solr part sounds like its gonna be interesting :D 17:05 <BogdanVancea> I'll go finish up my application then. 17:05 <BogdanVancea> have a nice evening, good bye 17:05 <sdumitriu1> Bye 17:05 <krinye> has joined #ccm 17:34 <Krinye> has joined #ccm 20:22 <phenotips_org> has joined #ccm 22:24 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm
